body:
Who is the author of ,,The Fellowship of the Ring“?
a) Charles Dickens
b) J.R.R. Tolkien
c) William Shakespeare
d) Mark Twain

What kind of world does J.R.R Tolkien emphasize in his novels?
a) fantastic world
b) real world
c) romantic world
d) ancient world
What kind of beings does J.R.R. Tolkien include in his works?

Which other famous fantasy novel is J.R.R. Tolkien known for?
а) Oliver Twist
b) Hamlet
c) A Midsummer Night's Dream
d) The Hobbit

J.R.R. Tolkien is a/an .......writer, poet and academic.
a) American
b) Indian
c) Enlish
d) Australian

Who is the author of ,,Hamlet“?
a) William Shakespeare
b) Doris Lessing
c) Jane Austen
d) Nathaniel Hawthorne

Where is William Shakespeare born?
a) Manchester, England
b) Ohio, USA
c) Salem, Massachusetts
d) Stratford-upon-Avon, England
William Shakespeare was the father of the English.........

Shakespeare's works are still enormously popular even today.
a) True
b) False

In which town did Shakespeare pursue a career in the theatre?
a) Oxford
b) London
c) Manchester
d) Edinburgh

How many plays in total did Shakespeare write?
a) 38
b) 71
c) 55
d) 29

How many sonnets in total did Shakespeare write?
a) 45
b) 134
c) 154
d) 90
Where were Shakespeare's plays frequently staged?

When were Shakespeare's most productive years?
a) 1569-1578
b) 1601-1613
c) 1552-1560
d) 1589-1613

Which title was NOT created by Shakespeare?
a) Hamlet
b) Hard Times
c) King Lear
d) Macbeth

Where did Shakespeare die?
a) Stratford
b) Kenilworth
c) Alcester
d) Rugby

How did Claudius murder King Hamlet?
a) by stabbing him through an arras
b) by ordering him to be hanged
c) by pouring poison into his ear
d) by poisoning his wineglass

Whose skull does Hamlet discover in the churchyard?
a) The former court jester's
b) Ophelia's
c) Reynaldo's
d) His father's

Where do Hamlet and Laertes fight during Ophelia's funeral?
a) in the nearby woods
b) inside the church
c) beside Ophelia's grave
d) inside the grave itself

Which of the following characters survive the play?
a) Horatio
b) Claudius
c) Prince Hamlet
d) Ophelia

How does Ophelia die?
a) Claudius stabs her
b) She slits her wrists
c) Hamlet strangles her
d) She drowns in the river

Why, according to Polonious, has Hamlet gone mad?
a) he grieves too much for his father
b) he is in love with Ophelia
c) he despises Claudius for marrying Getrude
d) he is jealous Laertes and longs to return Wittenberg

Who is the last character that died in the play?
a) Horation
b) Claudius
c) Hamlet
d) Fortinbras

Who says the famous "To be, or not be" soliloguy?
a) Claudius
b) The ghost
c) Hamlet
d) Laertes

Why does Hamled decide not to kill Claudius after the travelling players' play?
a) Claudius is praying
b) Claudius pleads for mercy
c) Claudius is asleep
d) Getrude is in the next room

Which of Claudius and Laerte's traps for Hamlet succeeds in killing him?
a) the poisoned cup
b)the poisoned dagger
c) the sharpened sword
d) the poisoned sword

The following words are part of a rhyming couplet - "The time is out of joint. O cursed spite, That ever I was born to set it right!"
a) True
b) False

Black verse is .........
a) rhymed
b) unrhymed

In Shakespeare's plays, .......... are used to sum up the end of a character's speech, very often right at the end of a scene.
a) rhyming couplets
b) blank verses
Most of Shakespeare's plays were written in the style of .......... drama.
What did the ring look to be made of?

What effect does Bilbo's ring have on its wearer?
a) it makes him invisible
b) it gives him strength
c) it enables him to see in the dark
d) it has seemingly no effect

What is the name of the fiery mountain where the One ring was forged?
a) Caradhras
b) Orodruin
c) Orthanc
d) Dúnedain

Which terrible creature does Gandalf battle during the journey through Moria?
a) The Barrow-wight
b) The Uruk-hai
c) The Balrog
d) The Nazgûl

Boromir suggests the Fellowship to go to the city of Minas Tirith.
a) True
b) False

"It's enough to make a cat laugh" is an example of ........... personification.
a) object
b) animal
c) abstract idea
d) none

What kind of personification is "it" that is underlined in the first paragraph?
a) none
b) abstract idea
c) animal
d) object

"Opportunity was knocking at her door" is an example of object personification.
a) True
b) False

What is the synonym of the of the word "toad"?
a) a frog
b) a lion
c) bird
d) none of the mentioned
What does the word "shears" mean?

Continue the sentence: "springing up like a dog.......".
a) ready for a walk
b) discouraged for a walk
c) invited for a walk
d) not ready for a walk

The antonym of the word "weakening" is phrase "getting strong".
a) False
b) True
